snippet: Hall of Fame catcher Roy Campanella, permanently paralyzed in a car crash 33 years ago, added his name yesterday to the list of well-wishers pulling for jockey Bill Shoemaker to recover from his paralysis.   Shoemaker, 59 years old, who won more r...
lead_paragraph: Hall of Fame catcher Roy Campanella, permanently paralyzed in a car crash 33 years ago, added his name yesterday to the list of well-wishers pulling for jockey Bill Shoemaker to recover from his paralysis. Shoemaker, 59 years old, who won more races than any other jockey, remained in critical condition yesterday at Centinela Hospital in Inglewood, Calif. On Monday night, he suffered a broken neck when his car went off a freeway and tumbled down a steep embankment.
